pullRequest.title: Show meaningful error message on missing permissions instead of redirecting to not found page
pullRequest.bodyText:
We are currently redirecting the user to /notfound when an api response has the status code 403.
With this PR we are no longer changing the url and providing a proper error message instead of the not found page.
While this PR is focused on unauthorized and react runtime errors, we can also use the error reporting to display the 404 Page (while staying on the same page) when a user tries to access a view which does not exist, instead of redirecting the user to /notfound
This PR adds:

implements the ErrorsAction report which is being used to report unauthorized and react runtime errors
implements two error boundaries, one app for unauthorized and react runtime errors and one for the routing which also catches runtime errors inside e.g. the navigation
unifies the error pages layout
bundles the error related components inside an own component directory.

Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Refactoring (non-breaking change)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)

Checklist:



 My code follows the code style of this project.
 My change requires a change to the documentation.
 I have updated the documentation accordingly.
 I have read the CONTRIBUTING document.
 I have added tests to cover my changes.

nodes.bodyText: We can improve the naming a bit by turning this into ReactError and rename the function used to create one to createReactError, same for UnauthorizedErrorInternal.
Although it is not checked yet, we should use the same semicolon-rule for flow code and append one at the end of a statement.

suppressConsole should wrap the smallest possible scope to prevent suppressing valid console output, so maybe we can narrow it down? Why do we need it here anyway, I think there is not exception raised in here?

Maybe we could create a factory (createFromFetchError?) in the ReportedErrors module which just takes the error and returns a proper subtype? It could look at the status field to find out which type to return. No need to do it in this PR though.
Optional: too many parentheses.

beforeCommit.message: Decrease ErrorJumbotron background opacity to improve readability

commit.message:
Add displayError action to handle global errors

- Add class for app errors
- Create separate component to display errors
- Rename ErrorBoundary to RuntineErrorBoundary
Do not redirect to not found page on unauthorized api requests and display global error instead
Rename ErrorsAction displayError to report
Include ScretchPad and ScrollToHint component in app runtime error boundary
Use styled components for RuntimeErrorPage
Unify runtime and unauthorized error page layout
Fix RuntimeErrorBoundary test
Rename AppError component to ReportedError
Add separate error boundary for routing
Rename AppError in ReportedError and use objects instad of a class
Fix linting errors
ADjust ReportedError creation and fix flow error
Only reset reported error on route change when reported error is being displayed
Fix RuntimeErrorBoundary test
Remove not needed prop in RouterErrorBoundary test
Unsubscribe from report error action when unmounting ReportedError component
Add test for ReportedError

Create own components directory for error handling related components

* Rename ReportedErrorDetails to ErrorPage
Imolement ErrorPage layout for PageErrorOverview
Fix linter warning
Revert not working linter fix and add missing import
Fix reported error reset on route change
Display ErrorPage title inside ErrorJumbotron
Add test for RuntimeErrorPage and UnauthorizedErrorPage
Rename ReportedError.js file in ReportedErrors.js and rename functions to create reported errors
Fix typos
Use not found background image by default for ErrorPage component
Remove not needed suppressConsole from tests and restrict scope of remaining
Remove not needed parentheses
Remove not needed async keyword
Use wait instead of waitForElement inside tests
Decrease ErrorJumbotron background opacity to improve readability
Fix linter warnings
